viztools¶

Module for visualizing skill embeddings @author Siddharth Reddy <sgr45@cornell.edu> 01/08/15

viztools.plot_embedding(model, timestep=-1, show_students=True, show_assessments=True, show_lessons=None, show_prereqs=None, show_concepts=None, show_student_ids=False, show_assessment_ids=False, show_lesson_ids=False, show_concept_ids=False, id_padding_x=0.01, id_padding_y=0.01, alpha=0.5, size=20, title='', show_legend=True, force_invariant_axis_limits=True, axis_limit_padding=0.1, show_pass_rates=False, x_axis_limits=None, y_axis_limits=None)¶

Plot students, assessments, lessons, and prereqs in a two-dimensional skill embedding

Students, assessments, prereqs = points Lessons = vectors

See SyntheticExperiments.ipynb for example invocations

Parameters:
  • model (EmbeddingModel) – A skill embedding model
  • timestep (int) – A timestep. By default, timestep=-1 => latest snapshot
  • id_padding_x (float) – Padding between object and id along x-axis
  • id_padding_y (float) – Padding between object and id along y-axis
  • alpha (float) – Alpha level for scatterplot points’ color
  • size (int) – Size of scatterplot points
  • title (str|None) – Title of plot
  • show_legend (bool) – True => show legend in upper left corner False => do not show legend
  • force_invariant_axis_limits (bool) – True => plot will have same axes limits regardless of timestep, False => plot may have different axes limits depending on timestep
  • axis_limit_padding (float) – Padding for axis limits (to prevent points from being stuck at the edges of the plot)
  • show_pass_rates (bool) – True => color assessments by pass rate, False => don’t color assessments
  • x_axis_limits (list[int,int]|None) – [x_min, x_max]
  • y_axis_limits (list[int,int]|None) – [y_min, y_max]
